page.title: 01Introduction.
page.content: Cutcombe is a small village on Exmoor. The village has developed in two parts, Cutcombe village itself with the church and Wheddon Cross at the cross-roads. The houses in the village are a mixture of new and old. Some are made of stone or brick and some are thatched. There are many good views from the village especially the view towards Dunkery Beacon. There are farms all round the village and they are mixed farms. The village pub is called The Rest and be Thankful. This is an old name and in the past travellers who had come up the long steep hills to the village were thankful to be able to have a rest, a drink and some food and even to stay the night.
